intro: Arthromeris kachinensis, commonly known as the Kachin thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
